sub_title: Food Loss and Waste Consultant at FAO, Food Systems and Food Safety Division
summary:
"Produced but never eaten". I aspire to actively contribute to achieving sustainable food security and Nutrition for #ZeroHunger,  through efficient and integrated interventions that reduce food losses and improve food safety. My areas of interest: Agriculture and Livestock Value Chains Development, Food Safety and Quality management systems, post-harvest handling and management, Food processing, value addition, Food and Nutrition security, with six years of working experience in the food industry, NGO and UN. 
Core skills
Pro-activeness, innovative, Excellence, integrity, ownership, independent, coordination, multitasking, communication, ideation, Problem solving, research, writing, analytical, strategic and logical thinking

Project’s three broad lines of interventions: Curriculum Development/Revision; strengthening the research & innovation capacities; and outreach services.
Beneficiaries: higher Learning and TVET Institutions, extension officers and private sector (farmers, cooperatives, agribusinesses )
Aim: To contribute to sustainable food security and nutrition in Rwanda
Focus: Dairy, Potato, Poultry, Horticulture and cross-cutting themes.  
Key responsibilities  
Initiated and coordinated the implementation of SEAD project activities in the Northern region
Supported the project team with planning, organizing, and monitoring project activities
Conducted needs assessment of smallholder farmers ’cooperatives and agro-food SMEs across potato and Dairy value chains.
Capacitated value chain actors on value addition, post-harvest management, food safety and quality management systems.
Organized and facilitated project workshops and training 
Played a central role in advising, guiding, and identifying strategic networks within value chain regions.
Established, maintained, and expanded the relationship between the Agro-food Value Chain Stakeholders (i.e. education & training institutions, projects and NGOs, private sector and public sector/Government).
Supported the SEAD PMT in ensuring regular monitoring and evaluation of activities for interventions delivering clear results and impact based on robust data;
Supported the establishment of the Service Training & Innovation Centres (STIC) for Potato and Dairy value chains; a self-sustainable commercial PPP interface centre even beyond the duration of the project.
Provided secretarial & logistical support to PMT and Value Chains technical meetings and SEAD workshops & training events.
Provided relevant recommendations to PMT on the spending of resources and timely justification on project expenditures.', 'title': 'Regional Dairy and Potato Value Chains Coordinator  for SEAD Project', 'employment_type': 'Full-time'}]}, {'company': {'id': 22320481, 'name': 'Africa Improved Foods', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C560BAQFFRe0YL6N8rg/company-logo_400_400/0/1519892797314?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=jez-lxrK9E7junPxW8eKzVeLwSlWnwPvdLNylJIs5lM', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/africaimprovedfoods/', 'employees': {'start': 201, 'end': 500}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}, 'end': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Kigali-Rwanda', 'date': {'start': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}, 'end': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}}, 'company': 'Africa Improved Foods', 'description': "Food Microbiologist at AFRICA IMPROVED FOODS (AIF): a subsidiary of Dutch Royal DSM Company- a manufacturer of fortified nutritious cereals and milk powder-based foods that are bought by the Government of Rwanda for the undernourished poorest people and WFP for its food assistance programs-based foods to tackle malnutrition.
Key accomplishments:  
Contributed to AIF FS22000 certification in 2017 and the designation and accreditation of AIF laboratories in 2018 for ISO 17025:2005.
Contributed to setting up AIF Laboratories
Developed SOPs, test methods and working instructions for equipment and machines.
Main responsibilities:
Spearheaded all food microbiology laboratory responsibilities.
Developed and documented three AIF laboratories' SOPs and test methods.
Tested, using culture-dependent techniques food, environment, and water associated spoilage and pathogenic microorganisms.
Supported qualitative and quantitative testing of mycotoxins
Reported conformity and non-conformity parameters.
Prepared test reports and certificates of analysis for clients.
Took a lead in solving analytical related problems and putting up precautions/preventive measures and corrective actions.
Represented AIF as a member of the Rwanda Standard Board Technical Committee (RSB-TC) on establishing Microorganisms and Mycotoxins limits in fortified cereal-based foods standards.
Technical member of Food safety Team (FST) dealing with: Management commitment to food safety, Company’s Food safety policy, risk communication (internal and external), Internal and external audit reports and implementation of corrective actions.
Assessed hygiene status on 3M processing factors (Man, Machine, and Materials) and processing environment to ensure quality and safety of the products.
Trained food handlers and operators on food safety and quality management systems HACCP, GMPs and GHPs;
Timely identified and requested equipment, culture media, and consumables needed in the laboratories.", 'title': 'Food Microbiologist', 'employment_type': 'Full-time'}]}, {'company': {'id': 2705833, 'name': 'International Livestock Research Institute (ILRI)', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4D0BAQEnvc1GfIOAvQ/company-logo_400_400/0/1519925578112?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=QHc5jrfJtjkelZ_iUxthb9awOHPkCpltFlFRfnhrUzQ', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/school/international-livestock-research-institute-ilri/', 'employees': {'start': 501, 'end': 1000}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}, 'end': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Nairobi', 'date': {'start': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}, 'end': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}}, 'company': 'International Livestock Research Institute (ILRI)', 'description': None, 'title': 'Intern', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'Africa Humanitarian Action (AHA)', 'logo': None, 'url': None, 'employees': {'start': None, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}, 'end': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Kiziba Refugee Camp-Karongi district-Rwanda', 'date': {'start': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}, 'end': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}}, 'company': 'Africa Humanitarian Action (AHA)', 'description': '	Reinforced nutritional supportive activities for refugees (Such as: complementary and therapeutic feeding, vegetables kitchen gardens, rabbit rearing, cassava leave plantation
